Reviewed 2 of 3 files at r1, 1 of 2 files at r3, 2 of 2 files at r4. Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 1 unresolved discussion, some commit checks failed. --- *[include/grpc/impl/codegen/grpc_types.h, line 297 at r4](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15240#-LBWGhL02nlX9q6tXtw6-r4-297:-LBWKwQ74OM6KLEu7B_m:b-4oxzvc) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/fcf612769c254f767856cb4f8d43d0ca88023393/include/grpc/impl/codegen/grpc_types.h#L297)):*
Previously, AspirinSJL (Juanli Shen) wrote…
Nit: Please state explicitly what value means `true`.
I think it would be fine to just say that the value is boolean. --- *[include/grpc/impl/codegen/grpc_types.h, line 298 at r4](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15240#-LBWGraK49hhr2LkF4V0:-LBWGraK49hhr2LkF4V1:b-d3zjyj) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/fcf612769c254f767856cb4f8d43d0ca88023393/include/grpc/impl/codegen/grpc_types.h#L298)):* > ```objc > /** Channel arg indicating if a target is grpclb loadbalancer. The > * type of this arg is an integer and the value is treated as a bool. */ > #define GRPC_ARG_TARGET_IS_GRPCLB_LOAD_BALANCER \ > ``` These args are only used internally, so I don't think they need to be defined in grpc_types.h. Instead, I suggest moving them to grpclb.h. --- *[include/grpc/impl/codegen/grpc_types.h, line 298 at r4](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15240#-LBWH7_eBPVhunwuYiQe:-LBWH7_eBPVhunwuYiQf:bi7vy75) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/fcf612769c254f767856cb4f8d43d0ca88023393/include/grpc/impl/codegen/grpc_types.h#L298)):* > ```objc > /** Channel arg indicating if a target is grpclb loadbalancer. The > * type of this arg is an integer and the value is treated as a bool. */ > #define GRPC_ARG_TARGET_IS_GRPCLB_LOAD_BALANCER \ > ``` Note that the term "target" is misleading here, because this isn't about the target name; it's about the resulting address(es). I think we should use "address" instead. --- *[src/core/lib/security/credentials/google_default/google_default_credentials.cc, line 50 at r4](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15240#-LBWKDZT9BxMjUByKARY:-LBWKDZT9BxMjUByKARZ:b-tcvmzx) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/fcf612769c254f767856cb4f8d43d0ca88023393/src/core/lib/security/credentials/google_default/google_default_credentials.cc#L50)):* > ```cpp > /* -- Default credentials. -- */ > > static grpc_channel_credentials* default_credentials = nullptr; > ``` Global variables should start with a `g_` prefix. (This is a pre-existing issue, not something new with this PR, but we might as well fix it while we're here.) --- *[src/core/lib/security/credentials/google_default/google_default_credentials.cc, line 79 at r4](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15240#-LBWIQeyByH1IoIIrIi7:-LBWIQeyByH1IoIIrIi8:b-1vzcno) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/fcf612769c254f767856cb4f8d43d0ca88023393/src/core/lib/security/credentials/google_default/google_default_credentials.cc#L79)):* > ```cpp > grpc_google_default_channel_credentials* c = > reinterpret_cast(creds); > bool is_grpclb_load_balancer = > ``` Suggest using `grpc_channel_arg_get_bool()` for these: https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/src/core/lib/channel/channel_args.h#L119 For example: ``` bool is_grpclb_load_balancer = grpc_channel_arg_get_bool( grpc_channel_args_find(args, GRPC_ARG_TARGET_IS_GRPCLB_LOAD_BALANCER), false); ``` --- *[src/core/lib/security/credentials/google_default/google_default_credentials.cc, line 95 at r4](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15240#-LBWJAIV95-nV9Z6gr-y:-LBWJAIV95-nV9Z6gr-z:b4edp0r) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/fcf612769c254f767856cb4f8d43d0ca88023393/src/core/lib/security/credentials/google_default/google_default_credentials.cc#L95)):* > ```cpp > : c->ssl_creds->vtable->create_security_connector( > c->ssl_creds, call_creds, target, args, sc, new_args); > static const char* args_to_remove[] = { > ``` I don't think it's necessary to remove these. It should be fine to let them propagate to the subchannel. --- *[src/core/lib/security/credentials/google_default/google_default_credentials.cc, line 338 at r4](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15240#-LBWJgicAUJLtCVEoPdr:-LBWJgicAUJLtCVEoPds:bddhnu) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/fcf612769c254f767856cb4f8d43d0ca88023393/src/core/lib/security/credentials/google_default/google_default_credentials.cc#L338)):* > ```cpp > if (alts_creds != nullptr) { > creds->alts_creds = grpc_channel_credentials_ref( > grpc_composite_channel_credentials_create(alts_creds, call_creds, > ``` Instead of making both the SSL and ALTS credentials composite credentials that include the call creds and then choosing between them, why not do the composition with the call creds at the google default creds level? In other words, first create the google default creds that contains the SSL and ALTS creds, and then compose the google default creds with the call creds. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15240)*

Done --- *[src/core/lib/security/credentials/google_default/google_default_credentials.cc, line 79 at r4](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15240#-LBWIQeyByH1IoIIrIi7:-LBaoYui2yBFCyPHP2sa:b-896fjx) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/fcf612769c254f767856cb4f8d43d0ca88023393/src/core/lib/security/credentials/google_default/google_default_credentials.cc#L79)):*
Previously, markdroth (Mark D. Roth) wrote…
Suggest using `grpc_channel_arg_get_bool()` for these: https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/src/core/lib/channel/channel_args.h#L119 For example: ``` bool is_grpclb_load_balancer = grpc_channel_arg_get_bool( grpc_channel_args_find(args, GRPC_ARG_TARGET_IS_GRPCLB_LOAD_BALANCER), false); ```
Done --- *[src/core/lib/security/credentials/google_default/google_default_credentials.cc, line 95 at r4](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15240#-LBWJAIV95-nV9Z6gr-y:-LBapWehDu_5RNs6boPm:b-vedu85) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/fcf612769c254f767856cb4f8d43d0ca88023393/src/core/lib/security/credentials/google_default/google_default_credentials.cc#L95)):*
Previously, markdroth (Mark D. Roth) wrote…
I don't think it's necessary to remove these. It should be fine to let them propagate to the subchannel.
I think we had a discussion on this issue before. If we do not remove these channel args, the sub-channels to backends and fallback addresses will have different channel args. And if at some point, we want to switch into and out of fallback mode, we need to re-connect to all of the backends. How do you think? --- *[src/core/lib/security/credentials/google_default/google_default_credentials.cc, line 338 at r4](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15240#-LBWJgicAUJLtCVEoPdr:-LBarC0L0LjD3rSeFhWT:blgqo02) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/fcf612769c254f767856cb4f8d43d0ca88023393/src/core/lib/security/credentials/google_default/google_default_credentials.cc#L338)):*
Previously, markdroth (Mark D. Roth) wrote…
Instead of making both the SSL and ALTS credentials composite credentials that include the call creds and then choosing between them, why not do the composition with the call creds at the google default creds level? In other words, first create the google default creds that contains the SSL and ALTS creds, and then compose the google default creds with the call creds.
Great suggestion. The code is revised. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15240)*
